name: Alophia_graniticola
collectorTeam: A.R. Silva, G.E.A. Fernandes, A.O. Simoes
locality: Parauapebas, FLONA de Carajas (Floresta Nacional de Carajas), Pedra da Harpia, 610 m
remarks: doi:10.1600/036364421X16231782047433 The name refers to the habitat of the species, associated to granitic formations.

name: Cypella_aurinegra
distribution: Uruguay (Southern South America, Southern America);Rio Grande do Sul (Brazil South, Brazil, Southern America);

name: Cypella_cruenta
distribution: Rio Grande do Sul (Brazil South, Brazil, Southern America)
remarks: doi:10.5902/2358198066131 The epithet means bloody or covered in blood, and refers to the perigone color, which is conspicuously stained of reddish-brown.

name: Herbertia_guyunusae
distribution: Rio Grande do Sul (Brazil South, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: São Gabriel, RS473, Cerro do Ouro
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.570.1.5 Etymology: 'a tribute to María Micaela Guyunusa (1806–1834). Guyunusa was one of the last Charrúa women; she was born in Paysandú and was one of the four Charrúas sent by Francois de Curel to France. She died in Lyon in the year 1834 (Rivet 1930, Asenjo 2007)'.

name: Sisyrinchium_caratuvense

remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.541.2.5 Etymology: 'The species epithet refers to the type locality, the Caratuva peak in the Paraná state'.

name: Sisyrinchium_usneoides
distribution: Minas Gerais (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America)
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.541.2.5 Etymology: 'The species epithet is a reference to the general appearance of the vegetative parts of the plant that resemble the habit of lichens of the genus Usnea Dill. ex Adans., as well as the bromeliad Tillandsia usneoides (L.) L.'.
